page.title: 05Buxton as a Centre.
page.content: {Buxton's Commercial Centre.} The survey area included the commercial centre of Buxton which is the area around Spring Gardens and the area around the Market Place. It was generally agreed that Buxton had a large number of amenities for a town of its size. This reflects two facts. Firstly, Buxton is an important regional centre. Surveys of where shoppers came from showed that many came from surrounding smaller settlements. Secondly, Buxton is an important tourist centre for the Peak District. {Shopping.}The most important shops are to be found along Spring Gardens. This was proved by a pedestrian count. The count also showed that a greater proportion of the shoppers on Spring Gardens had travelled further than those shopping on the Market Place.
